title: Inflation Surge Will Leave a Mark
sub_head: Even when inflation caused by supply-chain woes recedes, there are worrying signs the Fed will have to act to corral services inflation
body:
Rising goods costs drove U.S. consumer prices up by 7.5% from a year earlier last month. But if you are worried about inflation, that might not be the biggest thing to worry about.
The Labor Department’s inflation report Thursday was even hotter than forecasters expected. Economists thought that January’s headline figure would show a 0.4% rise from December, putting it 7.2% higher than a year earlier, rather than the 0.6% gain on the month and 7.5% gain on the year it showed. They thought core prices, which exclude food and energy items to better capture inflation’s trend, would also increase 0.4%, putting them 5.9% higher than a year earlier. Instead, core prices were up 0.6% from December and 6% on the year.
